entry.et: Middle English, from Old English hū; akin to Old High German hwuo how, Old English hwā who who

def.dt: :in what manner or way
:for what reason :why
:with what meaning :to what effect
:by what name or title
:to what degree or extent
:in what state or condition how are you
:at what price how a score of ewes now Shakespeare
:what do you say to or think of how about it, are you going?
:how does it happen that :why
:the way or manner in which remember how they fought
:the state or condition in which
:that told them how he had a situation Charles Dickens
:however as a reader can shift his attention how he likes William Empson
:a question about manner or method
:manner method
:giving practical instruction and advice (as on a craft) how–to books on all sorts of hobbies Harry Milt
:a practical method or instruction the how–tos of balancing a checkbook
:something (as a book) that provides such instruction

dt.un: used to emphasize the preceding idea having a great time—and how!

def.dt: :that allowed as how she was glad to be here
:knowledge of how to do something smoothly and efficiently :expertise

entry.et: Middle English fer, from Old English feorr; akin to Old High German ferro far, Old English faran to go fare

def.dt: :at or to a considerable distance in space wandered far from home
:to a great extent :much far better methods
:by a broad interval :widely the far distant future
:to or at a definite distance, point, or degree as far as I know
:to an advanced point or extent a bright student will go far worked far into the night
:at a considerable distance in time not far from the year 1870
:far and away is by far the best runner
:it would be inappropriate or impossible for far be it from God, that he should do wickedness Job 34:10(Authorized Version)
:of a distinctly different and especially opposite quality than the trip was far from a failure
:to what extent, degree, or distance didn't know how far to trust them
:to a certain extent, degree, or distance when the water rose so far, the villagers sought higher ground
:up to the present has written just one novel so far
:so far thus far our findings have been negative
